title: Interaction
description: An `Interaction` is a significant direct exchange of ideas or information between a number of participants, e.g. a Sell Side party and one or more Buy Side parties. An `Interaction` might be a call, a meeting (physical or virtual), an IM or the preparation of some specialist data, such as financial data for a given company or sector.

id.title: Interaction Id
id.description: Can be used by a target application to pass an identifier back to the originating application after an interaction record has been created, updated or deleted. An interaction ID does not need to be populated by the originating application, however the target application could store it for future reference and SHOULD return it in a `TransactionResult`.

URI.title: Interaction URI
URI.description: Can be used by a target application to pass a record's link back to the originating application. This offers the originating application a way to open the record for a user to view.

participants.title: Interaction Participants
participants.description: A list of contacts involved in the interaction

timeRange.title: Interaction Time range
timeRange.description: The time range over which the interaction occurred

interactionType.title: Interaction Type
interactionType.description: `interactionType` SHOULD be one of `'Instant Message'`, `'Email'`, `'Call'`, or `'Meeting'` although other string values are permitted.

description.title: Interaction Description
description.description: A human-readable description of the interaction

initiator.title: Interaction Initiator
initiator.description: The contact that initiated the interaction

origin.title: Interaction Origin
origin.description: Used to represent the application or service that the interaction was created from to aid in tracing the source of an interaction.
